{"step_by_step_thinking": "Epigenetic changes do not change the DNA sequence. Epigenetic changes refer to modifications that occur on the DNA molecule or the proteins associated with it, without altering the underlying DNA sequence. These changes can affect gene expression and can be influenced by various factors such as environmental exposures, lifestyle choices, and aging. However, they do not involve changes in the actual DNA sequence itself.", "answer_choice": "B"}
